intro: Calepina, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. Calepina is often found in Europe and western Asia, and it has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
